question.body: What is the best description of the hormone inhibin?

multiple_choice.choice: It is produced by the placenta and inhibits contractions.
It is produced by the pituitary gland and inhibits testosterone production.
It is produced by the gonads and inhibits FSH release.
It is produced by the ovaries and increases FSH production.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The placenta does not secrete inhibin.
Incorrect. Inhibin inhibits the release of FSH from the pituitary but it is not produced by the pituitary gland.
Correct. Inhibin is produced by the ovaries and testes which are the gonads and inhibits FSH release.
Incorrect. Inhibin is secreted by the ovaries but it inhibits FSH release
